subject: FW: UTM code tracking via website forms
preview: Hi Heath,My name is Tim Ball at Marketo. We have been testing this afternoon with Fleur to see why the data on one of her forms is not syncing to Marketo on a Shortcuts campaign landing page.https://w

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,

My name is Tim Ball at Marketo. We have been testing this afternoon with Fleur to see why the data on one of her forms is not syncing to Marketo on a Shortcuts campaign landing page.

https://www.shortcuts.com.au/cloud-reporting/?utm_source=marketo&utm_medium=edm&utm_campaign=cloudreporting&utm_content=landingpage

It would appear that the form app in Wordpress is picking up the utm parameters but then the hidden field data is not getting pushed over to Marketo. (See attached logs).

Can we check that the API names are correct at your end. It only seems to be an issue when we are pulling the url parameters. If we hard code a default string into the fields the data is getting pushed over

Kind regards

Tim

action.text: Heath Maguire assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body: Hey @joel , let's talk about this one... I'll need to quote her before we make any changes. Cheers

Hi Heath

Marketo have now looked into this issue and we have confirmed that the website form is not pushing the UTM data through into Marketo.

It appears that although the form itself is collecting the UTM fields, this is never reaching Marketo, so it is almost certainly an issue on the website end.

See the attached image which Marketo provided.

Marketo suggested perhaps a piece of Javascript may be required to fix this? But they can’t really identify the issue for us.

Any chance you could start work on this on Monday? We have a major campaign going live next week and I would love to be able to track the results.

NB I need to make a couple of changes before you do this work.

Please let me know how much this will cost.

Cheers
Fleur

<>
From: Fleur Murphy
Sent: Monday, 4 February 2019 10:32 AM
To: Tim Ball <tball@marketo.com <mailto:tball@marketo.com>>
Subject: FW: UTM code tracking via website forms

Hi Tim

Please see below email thread with our web developer.

In particular, please see the section I’ve highlighted.

I believe it is something within the UTM code data itself that is breaking things.

I’m not sure how others have done this successfully?

The data is flowing through to Marketo from the field, but UTM data specifically breaks it.

I’ve been testing with this form: https://www.shortcuts.com.au/cloud-reporting/ <https://www.shortcuts.com.au/cloud-reporting/>

Thanks
Fleur


From: Heath Maguire [mailto:heath@wpperk.com <mailto:heath@wpperk.com>]
Sent: Monday, 14 January 2019 3:49 PM
To: Fleur Murphy <Fleur.Murphy@shortcuts.com.au <mailto:Fleur.Murphy@shortcuts.com.au>>
Subject: Re: UTM code tracking via website forms

Hi Fleur,

Firstly Happy New Year!

That could be the case, particularly if the form flows through without the parameter name. It’s kind of dynamic and that may be confusing Marketo.

I’m assuming you need this information in Marketo, because if not, the easiest thing would be to strip it out. Alternatively, maybe we could just send through the entire referring URL, it’s not pretty, but with a keen eye the data can be seen.

Have Marketo come back with anything as yet?

Thanks and speak soon,
Heath Maguire
Director

E. heath@wpperk.com <mailto:heath@wpperk.com> | P. 1300 072 134 <tel:1300%20072%20134> | M. 0415 162 271 <tel:0415%20162%20271>
<https://wpperk.com/>


On 11 Jan 2019, at 12:57 pm, Fleur Murphy <fleur.murphy@shortcuts.com.au <mailto:fleur.murphy@shortcuts.com.au>> wrote:

Hi Heath

Finally had a chance to start implementing this. Thanks a million for your video, it’s super helpful!

I’ve set up and tested the Cloud Reporting form using the email address kenkesey@shortcuts.com.au <mailto:kenkesey@shortcuts.com.au>.

All the data from the UTM code flowed successfully into the form entry. Yay!!

<image001.png>

But unfortunately it’s not flowing through to Marketo now that I’ve added the parameter name to the form.

<image003.jpg>

Interestingly, I set this up wrong to start with and pasted the parameter name into the default value field by accident.

When I did it that way, the info was passed through to Marketo without a hitch (although of course it was the wrong data).

This makes me think it’s something in the actual UTM data that’s getting passed up that’s breaking things.

Was wondering if you can see anything from your end to gauge what might be going wrong?

Will reach out to Marketo about this too.

Cheers
Fleur

From: Heath Maguire [mailto:heath@wpperk.com <mailto:heath@wpperk.com>]
Sent: Wednesday, 17 October 2018 3:47 PM
To: Fleur Murphy <Fleur.Murphy@shortcuts.com.au <mailto:Fleur.Murphy@shortcuts.com.au>>
Subject: Re: UTM code tracking via website forms

Check this out: https://www.useloom.com/share/93db3904b8ed4d7086961dc609cb7d60 <https://www.useloom.com/share/93db3904b8ed4d7086961dc609cb7d60> : )

I think this will do the trick?

Thanks,
Heath Maguire

On 16 Oct 2018, at 11:06 am, Fleur Murphy <fleur.murphy@shortcuts.com.au <mailto:fleur.murphy@shortcuts.com.au>> wrote:

Hi Heath

Just spoke with Marketo again about this, I think this will be reasonably easy to set up.

All we need is to find a way to capture the UTM code in a hidden field on all our forms.

I can then set this up to synch the information with Marketo.

Chat tomorrow

Cheers
Fleur

From: Heath Maguire [mailto:heath@wpperk.com <mailto:heath@wpperk.com>]
Sent: Monday, 15 October 2018 5:12 PM
To: Fleur Murphy <Fleur.Murphy@shortcuts.com.au <mailto:Fleur.Murphy@shortcuts.com.au>>
Subject: Re: UTM code tracking via website forms

Hi Fleur,

Yes. No worries at all! These are great for Google Analytics as well.

Perhaps we can have a phone call about this? I’ll need to get inside your head so far as how you are promoting the forms and what your are wanting to track/report on. Once we setup the forms to process and pass the UTM data, you can get as granular as you like.

Let me know when is good for a chat.

Thanks,

Heath Maguire
Director - WP Perk





P. 1300 072 134 <tel:1300%20072%20134> | M. 0415 162 271 <tel:0415%20162%20271>
E. heath@wpperk.com <mailto:heath@wpperk.com>
wpperk.com <http://wpperk.com/>

On 15 Oct 2018, at 5:05 pm, Fleur Murphy <Fleur.Murphy@shortcuts.com.au <mailto:Fleur.Murphy@shortcuts.com.au>> wrote:

Hi again Heath

I’m looking at adding some functionality to our website forms to capture the source and campaign via a UTM code.

I’ve spoken with Marketo and they have suggested that:

· We use Google UTM codes for all traffic to our website
· The UTM code would contain details such as source (i.e. Advertising) and medium (i.e. Instyle Magazine)
· The form itself would then need to modify the UTM code in some way (Marketo have suggested the “campaign” aspect of the UTM code), so we can start to associate a form completion with a particular source and campaign and track this all the way through to sale.

Just wondering if you’ve ever done something like this before?

Would love your thoughts and advice on how we would implement this.

Below is the information Marketo has provided on this.

Thanks
Fleur

++

Form capture method
By adding hidden fields to the form we can capture the direct utm parameters
Eg.
https://www.shortcuts.com.au/contact <https://www.shortcuts.com.au/contact>?utm_source=paid_search_sem&utm_medium=google_search&utm_campaign=au_contact_us_form
You would need to pass the parameter value to the value of the form. This may require a developer to set this up for you.
If your data is pushed to marketo you will just need to make sure that the input field values are pushed to the marketo api field names.


Fleur Murphy
Senior Marketing Manager
Shortcuts Software
p: +61 (0) 7-3834-3216 <tel:+61%207-3834-3216> | f: +61 (0) 7-3831-7844 <tel:+61%207-3831-7844>
